Dear Ms. Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is a concern for the staff not supervising the youth as they
are committing violence on themselves and others. On 4/13/25,
one youth threw a metal object at another youth's head causing a
small laceration to the right eyebrow. The youth was transported
to the hospital and no staff were present when it occurred.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 4/14/2025 and
reported no additional information.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
4/16/2025. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A recently had a
court hearing and was in her bedroom on the computer for the
hearing due to being sick. Foster Care Worker reported another
youth, unknown who, came into the bedroom and stuck up her
middle finger to the camera while Youth A was on camera for the
court hearing. Foster Care Worker reported a staff was not
viewed to be on camera for the court hearing however it is
believed a staff was present. Foster Care Worker reported Youth
A was not actively participating in the court hearing as she was
muting the computer and when Youth A was told by the judge to
unmute, Foster Care Worker reported it appeared a staff would
come into the room however Youth A was shooing the worker
away. Foster Care Worker reported there were concerns from the
court due to Youth A’s participation in the hearing and Youth A not
being in a more appropriate area with staff present where other
youth could not interrupt. Foster Care Worker reported she was
made aware of the incident that occurred resulting in Youth A’s
injury and had no further information or concerns.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/21/2025. Youth A reported on 4/13/2025 she went off grounds,
prom dress shopping. Youth A reported upon returning from prom
dress shopping she walked up to the facilities front door and
knocked as the door was closed and locked. Youth A reported
Youth B came to the door and opened the door and threw the
2

container at her eye, which caused a cut above her eye. Youth A
reported Youth B was mad at her for not doing Youth B’s hair.
Youth A reported she never told Youth B she would do her hair
that day. Youth A reported no staff were around when Youth B
threw the container at her eye. Youth A reported Staff 1 took her,
Youth D, and Youth E off grounds and upon returning, Staff 1
entered the house before Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E leaving
Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E outside the front of the house.
Youth A reported she and Youth D and Youth E were outside
alone for approximately three minutes knocking on the front door
of the house prior to Youth B opening the door. Youth A reported
Staff 2 came outside five minutes after Youth B threw the
container at her eye and helped clean up the injury. Youth A
reported Staff 1 came to assist five minutes after Staff 2 came out.
Youth A reported she and Youth B have never had any
issues/altercations prior to this incident.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/21/2025. Youth B reported Youth A was making comments to
her prior to Youth A leaving to go off grounds saying, “my dad will
shoot you; I hate you, I will kill you”. Youth B reported no one
heard Youth A making these comments to her as Youth A would
say them quietly to her when no one else could hear. Youth B
reported Youth A refused to do her hair for her. Youth B reported
she wanted to get back at Youth A and waited for Youth A to
return from off grounds and “made a move”. Youth B reported she
threw a container of edge control at Youth A’s face and walked
away. Youth B reported she opened the door and did not intend
to throw the container at Youth A as she was going to just ask
Youth A if she wanted to fight, however Youth B reported she just
threw the container. Youth B reported she did not recall who was
outside the door with Youth A when she threw the container.
Youth B reported staff were present however she did not recall
which staff. Youth B reported she had been upstairs and heard
knocking at the door and came down to see who was there and
went and opened the door. Youth B reported she and Youth A
had “issues” before however always go back to being friends.
Youth B reported she and Youth A had been getting along during
the day but then Youth A began making comments to her which
escalated her.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/21/2025. Youth C reported Youth B threw a container of edge
control at Youth A’s eye. Youth C reported she was standing on
the stairs when Youth B went to the door, opened the door, and
threw the container at Youth A’s face. Youth C reported a staff,
3

unable to recall who, was outside with Youth A when the incident
occurred, and another staff was getting the wand to metal detect
the youth as they were returning from an off grounds activity.
Youth C reported Youth A and Youth B sometimes yell at one
another however they always “make up and are friends”.
Youth D was attempted to be interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 4/21/2025 however refused to meet with
Consultant.
Youth E was interviewed via telephone on 5/8/2025. Youth E
reported she went on an outing with Staff 1, Youth A, and Youth
D. Youth E reported upon returning to the facility, she was at the
front door with Youth A, and Youth B was inside the house
refusing to open the door to let them in. Youth E reported Youth B
opened the door and threw a plastic edge container at Youth A
and the container hit Youth A in the eye causing a small cut.
Youth E reported she did not recall which other youth was outside
and witnessed the incident. Youth E reported a staff, unable to
recall who, was outside with her and Youth A when Youth B threw
the edge container. Youth E reported Youth B did not mean to
throw the container and hurt Youth A. Youth E reported Youth A
and Youth B got along and have never had any physical
altercations prior to this incident.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed face-to-face
at the facility on 4/21/2025. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported she was not at the facility however she was informed of
the situation. Staff 1 had taken Youth A and two other youth off
campus on 4/13/2025. Prior to Staff 1 taking Youth A off campus,
Youth B had asked Youth A to do her hair. Youth A went off
grounds without doing Youth B’s hair and upon Youth A returning
from off grounds, Youth B threw a plastic container at Youth A,
hitting Youth A in the eye causing a cut. Assistant Facility
Administrator reported Youth A was taken to the hospital and did
receive a butterfly band aid for the injury. Assistant Facility
Administrator reported Youth B opened the front door of the house
when Youth A returned and “chucked the container” at Youth A.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported there had been no
indications prior to that indicating Youth B was escalated or upset.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 4/21/2025. Chief Administrator was not present when
the incident occurred however reported Youth B did not throw a
metal container at Youth A, it was a plastic container. Chief
Administrator reported Youth A and Youth B are best friends again
4

and there have been no incidents since. Chief Administrator
reported Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were working when the
incident occurred. Chief Administrator reported there had been no
incidents of any altercations between Youth A and Youth B prior.
Chief Administrator reported there were nine youth in the house
on 4/13/2025 and no youth were on one-on-one with staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/21/2025. Staff 1 reported she took Youth A, Youth D, and Youth
E off grounds on 4/13/2025 to go look for prom dresses for Youth
A. Staff 1 reported they were off grounds for approximately three
hours. Staff 1 reported upon returning to the facility she walked to
the front door with Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E and was
waiting for the door to be opened as the door is locked so not just
anyone can walk into the facility. Youth B came to the door and
was “playing like she was not going to open the door”. Staff 1
reported Youth B opened the door and began “belittling” Staff 1,
Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E stating they were out too long and
demanding to go off grounds. Staff 1 reported Youth B was not
“belittling” in an aggressive manner. Staff 1 reported she was
standing behind Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E and had she felt
Youth B was being aggressive, she would have moved in front of
the youth. Staff 1 reported Youth B threw the container with no
indication of what she was going to do. Staff 1 reported Youth A
began bleeding as the container caused a cut above her eye.
Staff 1 reported Youth B just stood there for a minute as if she
was a little shocked by what happened. Staff 1 reported Youth B
had opened the door, made the statements about them being
gone too long and then threw the container all in under a minute.
Staff 1 reported she never left Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E
outside on the porch and was present when Youth B threw the
container. Staff 1 reported she did not recall which staff were on
shift however she recalled one staff being upstairs in the house
with three youth, and another staff being in the kitchen with youth
preparing dinner.
Staff 1 reported Youth B was quiet after the incident happened in
the living room and was later pacing in her bedroom. Staff 1
reported she did not think Youth B meant to throw the container at
Youth A or knew what damage throwing it would cause. Staff 1
reported Youth A and Youth B have had verbal arguments prior as
they tend to have a “big sister/little sister relationship”. Staff 1
reported Youth A and Youth B usually get along and Youth A will
do Youth B’s hair. Staff 1 reported Youth B apologized to Youth A
afterwards and told her that she did not mean to do what she did.
Staff 1 reported prior to going off grounds, Youth A and Youth B
5

were getting along well and normally are “pretty close”. Staff 1
reported she had no indication Youth B was upset with Youth A in
any way.
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams on 5/8/2025. Staff 2 reported
Youth B wanted her hair done on the day the incident occurred,
and she asked Youth A to do her hair. Youth A said no as she was
going off grounds to look for prom dresses. Staff 2 reported Youth
B had asked other youth in the facility to do her hair while Youth A
was gone, however they told her no. Staff 2 reported she was at
the top of the stairs when Youth B threw the container at Youth A.
Staff 2 reported she did not see the incident occur however heard
the whole incident. Staff 2 reported Youth A had just returned to
the facility from dress shopping with Youth D, Youth E, and Staff
1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was outside with Youth A, Youth D, and
Youth E when Youth B ran to the door and opened the door. Staff
2 reported to her knowledge, Staff 1 was still at the van writing
down the mileage and cleaning out the van and Youth A, Youth D,
and Youth E were waiting for Staff 1 at the front door. Staff 2
reported Staff 3 was getting the metal detector to check the youth
as they were coming back from off grounds. Staff 2 reported she
believed Staff 3 had Youth D and Youth E checking them with the
metal detector when Youth B threw the container at Youth A. Staff
2 reported she was the supervisor on shift and after the incident
occurred she was attempting to figure out what happened and
Staff 1 told her she did not see what happened as she was
cleaning out the car. Staff 2 reported it is normal for staff to clean
out the car and write mileage information down upon returning
from an outing and youth remain outside with the staff. Staff 2
reported when she came down the stairs Youth A was standing in
the entry way near the coat closet with blood on her face. Staff 2
reported she switched out with Staff 1 or Staff 3, she could not
remember, and they went upstairs to provide supervision to the
youth in their bedrooms, and Staff 2 provided medical attention to
Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B had not had any
issues earlier in the day to indicate something like this would
occur. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B had an “on/off
relationship” and described their relationship as one day they
would be best of friends and the next they would bully one
another. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B have never been
in any sort of physical altercation with one another. Staff 2
reported there was no indication leading up to the event that
would suggest Youth B was going to respond the way she did.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams on 5/8/2025. Staff 3 reported
Youth B had been asking youth at the house to do her hair that
6

day as she had asked Youth A earlier in the day and Youth A told
her no as she was going off grounds to go prom dress shopping.
Staff 3 reported she was on the main floor with Youth B and
another peer when Youth B saw the van return with Staff 1, Youth
A, Youth D, and Youth E. Staff 3 reported Youth B ran out of the
bedroom toward the front door. Staff 3 reported she told Youth B
to stop and come back as Staff 3 was outside the bathroom door
providing supervision to a youth who was on constant supervision
and needed one-on-one supervision while using the restroom to
ensure the youth did not self-harm. Staff 3 reported youth are not
supposed to open the door at the facility for youth or anyone to
enter the facility. Staff 3 reported the youth using the restroom
came out of the bathroom and she immediately went to the front
door and Youth B had just thrown the object at Youth A. Staff 3
reported she did not know if Staff 2 witnessed the incident and
reported Staff 1 was at the van finishing up paperwork when the
incident occurred. Staff 3 reported she believed Youth B opened
the door and threw the plastic container at Youth A. Staff 3
reported when youth return from off grounds, youth are supposed
to wait outside for the staff to finish the paperwork and then enter
the facility with staff in order to be checked with the metal
detector. Staff 3 reported after Youth B threw the container, Youth
B stood in shock, as though she did not know what her actions
caused. Staff 3 reported she was not sure if Youth A and Youth B
had any incidents earlier in the day as Staff 3 reported she had to
leave the facility briefly and did not get shift updates. Staff 3
reported Youth A and Youth B are typically “thicker than thieves”
and occasionally get in arguments however there have never
been any physical altercations between them. Staff 3 reported
Youth B should not have opened the front door, and that Youth B
has been informed of this on multiple occasions as Youth B has a
tendency of playing games at the door by not letting people in, etc.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of the kitchen on 4/13/2025 at 3:02pm was
reviewed on 4/21/2025. Staff 3 was in the kitchen with another
youth.
Video footage of the kitchen on 4/13/2025 showing the door
going down to the basement was reviewed on 4/21/2025.
Youth F was let downstairs with Assistant Facility Administrator at
2:34pm and returned back upstairs at 3:09pm.
Video footage of the upstairs hallway on 4/13/2025 was
reviewed on 4/21/2025. A youth, believed to be Youth B, was
7

sitting in the stairwell at the top of the stairs, however could not be
viewed other than her arm near some containers sitting on the
floor. Staff 2 was sitting in a chair providing supervision upstairs,
however the door was over three quarters of the way closed, and
Staff 2 did not have line of sight of the youth.
Video footage of the front door area on 4/13/2025 at 3:03pm
was reviewed on 4/21/2025. Youth B came down the stairs from
upstairs at 3:03pm holding something in her hand and walked to
the front door. Youth B stood inside the front door for
approximately ten seconds and opened the door and immediately
appeared to have thrown what was in her hand. Youth B stepped
back inside the door. Youth D walked through the door followed by
Youth A, Youth C, and Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed:
• New Hope Youth Academy Safety Plan for Youth A and
Youth B dated 4/14/2025: Youth A and Youth B are not to
be left alone, unsupervised at any time. Youth A and Youth
B are to have no physical contact at any time. Youth A and
Youth B cannot sit on the same couches or at the same
table and must be seated separately during transport.
Youth A and Youth B will not be allowed in each other’s
bedrooms. Safety plan was signed by staff.
• Youth B Behavior Safety Plan dated 12/24/2024: If staff feel
Youth B is going to attempt to start a physical altercation
and all de-escalation efforts have failed, staff need to be
within an arm’s length of Youth B.
• Youth F Safety Plan dated 4/9/2025: Youth F is on constant
supervision. Staff must be within arm’s length. When
Youth F uses the bathroom, the door must remain cracked
with staff right outside and staff should engage Youth D
verbally during this entire time.
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center Safety and
Security Policy: Line of sight supervision of youth at all
times. Line of sight supervision is defined as the basic level
of supervision of youth where the staff maintain a constant
visual on the youth. The facilities ratio is one staff to three
youth. Staff should ensure that appropriate supervision of
the youth is maintained at all times. Staff shall provide
effective positioning for optimal sight and sound supervision
of youth.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Reported dated
4/13/2025 for Youth A: Youth A was assaulted by another
8

youth in the house by throwing edge control at Youth A
causing her eyebrow to be spit open.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 211020245 for Youth A dated 4/13/2025
was consistent with the facilities internal incident report.
• McLaren Central Michigan Emergency Department
Discharge Instructions for Youth A dated 4/13/2025 for a
facial laceration.
• Email from Assistant Facility Administrator dated
4/21/2025: Assistant Facility Administrator reported she
had Youth F downstairs in her office at the time of the
incident. Staff 3 was in the kitchen cooking dinner at the
time Youth B went to the front door.
• Constant Supervision log for Youth F dated 4/13/2025
documented Youth F was with Assistant Facility
Administrator during the incident.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there was sufficiency of staff
at the facility. Staff 1 was returning from an off ground’s activity
with Youth A, Youth C, and Youth D and was clearly viewed via
video footage to walk in the door right behind Youth A, Youth C,
and Youth D, upon Youth B opening the door and throwing the
container of edge at Youth A. Staff 2 was upstairs with youth,
Staff 3 was in the kitchen with a youth, and Assistant Facility
Administrator was in the basement with Youth F.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not follow their internal supervision policy.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams on 5/8/2025. Staff 2 reported
she was at the top of the stairs when Youth B threw the container
at Youth A. Staff 2 reported she did not see the incident occur
however heard the whole incident.
9

Staff 3 was interviewed via teams on 5/8/2025. Staff 3 reported
she was on the main floor with Youth B and another peer when
Youth B saw the van return with Staff 1, Youth A, Youth D, and
Youth E. Staff 3 reported Youth B ran out of the bedroom toward
the front door. Staff 3 reported she told Youth B to stop and come
back as Staff 3 was outside the bathroom door providing
supervision to a youth who was on constant supervision and
needed one-on-one supervision while using the restroom to
ensure the youth did not self-harm. Staff 3 reported youth are not
supposed to open the door at the facility for youth or anyone to
enter the facility. Staff 3 reported the youth using the restroom
came out of the bathroom and she immediately went to the front
door and Youth B had just thrown the object at Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of the kitchen on 4/13/2025 at 3:02pm was
reviewed on 4/21/2025. Staff 3 was in the kitchen with another
youth.
Video footage of the upstairs hallway on 4/13/2025 was
reviewed on 4/21/2025. A youth, believed to be Youth B, was
sitting in the stairwell at the top of the stairs, however could not be
viewed other than her arm near some containers sitting on the
floor. Staff 2 was sitting in a chair providing supervision upstairs,
however the door was over three quarters of the way closed, and
Staff 2 did not have line of sight of the youth in the stairwell.
Video footage of the front door area on 4/13/2025 at 3:03pm
was reviewed on 4/21/2025. Youth B came down the stairs from
upstairs at 3:03pm holding something in her hand and walked to
the front door. Youth B stood inside the front door for
approximately ten seconds and opened the door and immediately
appeared to have thrown what was in her hand. Youth B steps
back inside the door. Youth D walked through the door followed by
Youth A, Youth C, and Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center Safety and
Security Policy: Line of sight supervision of youth at all
times. Line of sight supervision is defined as the basic level
of supervision of youth where the staff maintain a constant
visual on the youth. The facilities ratio is one staff to three
youth. Staff should ensure that appropriate supervision of
the youth is maintained at all times. Staff shall provide
10

effective positioning for optimal sight and sound supervision
of youth.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel files: Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 3 had no discipline in their personnel files and all
received supervision training refresher on 2/7/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance for following their internal
supervision policy as the facilities internal policy states staff will
provide line of sight supervision however no staff had line of sight
supervision on Youth B per video camera footage as Youth B was
viewed coming down the stair case from upstairs and going to the
front door while Staff 2 was upstairs providing line of sight
supervision to youth and Staff 3 was in the kitchen providing line
of sight supervision to another youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000667SI dated 9/13/2023, CAP approved 11/6/2023
(related to supervision)
SIR 2023C0000798SI dated 12/18/2023, CAP approved
12/18/2023 (not related to supervision)
SIR 2024SIC0001372 dated 6/18/2024, CAP approved 9/24/2024
(related to documentation for supervision not completed per the
facilities policy).
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A youth at the New Hope Youth Center was injured when another youth threw a plastic container at her face upon returning from an off-grounds trip, causing a laceration. The investigation found a sufficient number of staff were present, but it substantiated a failure to follow the facility's own supervision policy, as staff did not maintain line-of-sight supervision on the offending youth, which is a repeat violation. Management is directly culpable for this ongoing failure to enforce its written supervision procedures.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violation is for failure to follow the facility's internal supervision policy (Rule 400.4109), which required line-of-sight supervision of youth. This failure of supervision allowed a youth-on-youth assault to occur (Youth B throwing a container at Youth A, causing a laceration requiring hospital treatment). According to the instructions, 'Environmental or supervision failures' including 'youth-on-youth conflict escalating due to lack of supervision' are categorized as Moderate SIRs. The violation is not 'Severe' because the primary finding is the supervision policy failure, not a violation directly categorized under 'Safety and Violence' for the assault itself (which was an outcome of the supervision failure).
